DataElement.preferredName: Nuclear Proliferation-Related Ki-67 Measurement Result Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the number of cells visualized with Ki-67 in their nucleus.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the nucleus._Antigen Identified by Monoclonal Antibody Ki-67, encoded by the MKI67 gene, is a nuclear antigen expressed in proliferating cells but not in quiescent cells, and required for maintaining cell proliferation. Expression of this antigen occurs preferentially during late G1, S, G2, and M phases of the cell cycle, while in cells in G0 phase the antigen cannot be detected. Consequently, the monoclonal antibody Ki-67 is used in tumor pathology to detect proliferating cells in neoplastic diseases. This antigen is located in the nucleus, predominantly localized in the G1 phase in the perinucleolar region. In the later phases it is also detected throughout the nuclear interior, being predominantly localized in the nuclear matrix. In mitosis, it is present on all chromosomes. This antigen contains 1 FHA domain. Two alternative splicing forms exist, Long and Short. (from Swiss-Prot)_Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the nucleus.:Antigen Identified by Monoclonal Antibody Ki-67, encoded by the MKI67 gene, is a nuclear antigen expressed in proliferating cells but not in quiescent cells, and required for maintaining cell proliferation. Expression of this antigen occurs preferentially during late G1, S, G2, and M phases of the cell cycle, while in cells in G0 phase the antigen cannot be detected. Consequently, the monoclonal antibody Ki-67 is used in tumor pathology to detect proliferating cells in neoplastic diseases. This antigen is located in the nucleus, predominantly localized in the G1 phase in the perinucleolar region. In the later phases it is also detected throughout the nuclear interior, being predominantly localized in the nuclear matrix. In mitosis, it is present on all chromosomes. This antigen contains 1 FHA domain. Two alternative splicing forms exist, Long and Short. (from Swiss-Prot)

Concepts.definition: Antigen KI-67 protein (3256 aa, ~359 kDa) is encoded by the human MKI67 gene. This protein is required for cell proliferation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
